changelog.version:
August 24th, 2022 • Added all the squirrel actions in the forest!
• Tweaked a few forest actions.
• The feed animals action now gives you the squirrel if you didn't recruit it yet. You monster!
• Surprisingly, fixed a lot of glitches!

August 16th, 2022 • Added a new zone! Like the forest, it lacks squirrel actions and story bits for now. Wait, which zone? Well... That's up to you to discover. Just one hint : it's not after the forest.
• Changed the way travelling works : now, there can be alternative zones.
• Fixed a ton of glitches and typos.
• Reworked the yin yang magic tooltip.

August 11st, 2022 • Massive rework for all the action tooltips! Now they should all be more readable, and be way more easy on the eyes. No more missing effects by misreading!
• Fixed a lot of glitches that were in the forest.

August 10th, 2022 • Implemented all actions in the forest. There's no action stories nor squirrel actions yet, and numbers are prone to change, though!
• Fixed a visual glitch for firefox if you got high talent numbers.

August 6th, 2022 • Discovered a massive flaw in the level system, so it was reworked. Now levels are less efficient, but are still quite powerful. Talents and soulstones are untouched.
• Fixed a few glitches, as per usual.
• Made the dungeon too strong in the last update, nerfed it a bit.
• Changed the mana cost of all actions in the forest.

August 4th, 2022 Alright, it's time to work on the second zone! It has been unlocked, but is right now identical to the original forest, so I don't recommend trying it. You can still do it if you're bored, though. Also please do a backup before going in there!
• Fixed a few glitches, including one where the squirrel would eat your gold in your back.
• Made the small dungeon a bit harder.

August 1st, 2022 • Even more typos and glitched fixed! When will it stop?!
• The tab name is now "Idle Loops Reworked".
• Reworked the story bit tooltips! It is now more comfortable to read them.
• Rewrote the squirrel mode bits for petting the squirrel.

July 30th, 2022 • Fixed even more glitches and typos found by the alpha testers. My endless thanks!
• The party action and its squirrel actions have been slightly reworked.
• No more tooltips out of the screen!
• The magic fighter is no longer an action you should have access to... But I'll leave it for now, just as an optional challenge.
• Reputation is now more valuable! Supplies are now 450 gold, and haggle removes 30 gold.
• Every timer should now show minutes, hours and days too, instead of just seconds.

July 29th, 2022 • Fixed some more glitches found by the alpha testers. Thank you again!
• The hitbox for the little checkbox for switching mode is now way bigger.
• When clicking on the icon/human icon in the action list, you can now change the mode for that specific action! Now it's less awkward to set up your loop.

July 29th, 2022 • Fixed some glitch found by the alpha testers. Thank you!
• Fixed a lot of typos.
• From now on, once you lose your squirrel, you can't pet it anymore in that same loop.
• Added an hotkey for squirrel mode : shift + space toggles it on and off.

July 28th, 2022 Finally, here's the first version that's complete enough to be played! Have fun, everyone!
• Added all the squirrel actions.
• The magic figther is now finished.
• Fixed a variety of small glitches.

July 25th, 2022 • Buffed the exp system. Talents are now more powerful, and soulstones are similar, but stronger at the start. Additionally, you get twice more exp from the start.
• Reworked a bit the squirrel and the magic figther. They'll soon be complete!
• Fixes a few UI glitches that slipped in the last update.
July 24th, 2022 With the help of Reterino, reworked the UI for the stats and skills. It is now more compact and can allow everything to be seen wihtout needing to scroll down.

July 23th, 2022 • Added the squirrel mode! Right now, only "Wander" is compatible with it, but the rest will be added soon.
• Various little fixes, included some from more recent version of Lloyd's Idle Loops.
• Added the zone quick acces menu from Lloyd's latest version.
• Slightly changed the changelog : it didn't like having version names too long.

July 19th, 2022 • The value of mana has been reworked : now 1 second is worth 100 mana, not 50.
• The offline bonus system has been completely reworked.
• Various little fixes.

July 18th, 2022 • Temporarily deactivated unlocking z2. Once z1 finished, it'll be reactivated.
• Added a litte useless companion.
• Reworked picking locks and investigations to make them both more interesting.
• Added a magic fighter : he's too powerful for now, though.

July 17th, 2022 This is Lloyd's v1.7 version of Idle Loop.
It serves as the basis for this new version of the game.

q_a.a: Hover over "Stats" for how they work. What stats are important depend on what actions you need that uses them.
Short runs are better for the early game, but as your runs get longer and you accrue talent and soulstones, longer runs become more useful.

q_a.q: What should my first goal be?
q_a.a: Start with wandering until you have ways of getting mana back. Then try to find how to get some warrior lessions to give yourself a permanent boost, and then try fighting monsters!

q_a.q: How do skill increases / reductions work?
q_a.a: Increases multiply a reward by (1 + level / 60) ^ .25, so you'll see diminishing returns at higher levels. Reductions multiply a cost by 1 / (1 + level / 100), so you'll never be able to bring a cost completely to zero.

q_a.q: When should I use Dark Ritual?
q_a.a: Many people recommend performing another ritual when the cost is less than 5% of your soulstones. Of course, the choice is up to you and there may be cases where it's better to perform it sooner or later.

stories.story: You're a simple courier, on a long trip to deliver a high priority package. Just as you entered town, you tripped - breaking your glasses - and the package burst open, spilling a strange liquid on you. Immediately, your meager amount of mana started draining rapidly. Right as your mana became empty, you found yourself back in the moment the liquid was absorbed into your skin, with your tiny reserves filled... yet draining just as before. This happened again and again, the world resetting with you, until you decided you had to figure out a way to prolong how long these 'loops' were. Mana crystals are often stored in pottery around town, perhaps you'll start there ...

You reach the end of the dungeon, where a softly glowing orb floats on a pedastal. You've found the dungeon core - for the first level of the dungeon, at least. As you grasp it, the essence dives into you, infusing your very being with the power it holds. It is a small amount of power, but this is a small dungeon. You'll be back to take this power again, knowing with the foreign knowledge implanted that it will stay with you no matter when you are.

You reach the end of the dungeon again, but for the first time the core isn't glowing. It's always been thought that dungeon cores build based on the mana spent around them, but you're beginning to think the essence of it's previous incarnations drains it somehow. It doesn't always happen, but you'll need to put more mana into the world to take the core's benefits out of it. You shrug, accepting yet another oddity of the loops.

You've done it! You've bested the gods themselves and restored time to its rightful flow. You can stop looping at any moment. But, then again, you could keep going. There's always time later...

Thanks for playing my fan mod of Idle Loops! Big shout-out to the wonderful Stop_Sign for creating this amazing game and Omsi for all the Omsi version. You both have inspired me more than you can imagine. Hope everyone had fun! <3
--Lloyd

tooltip.explanation:
Each stat level reduces the relevant part of an action's mana cost by sqrt(1 + level/100).
Talent exp gain is equal to 1% of stat exp gain, and persists through loops.
Talent multiplies xp gain by (1 + sqrt(talentLevel)/2).
XP gain towards a stat per action is (original mana / actual mana) * (talent bonus) * (soulstone bonus) per tick.

e.g. Meet People costs 1600 mana and has a breakdown of Int 10% Cha 80% Soul 10%.
This effectively means 160 of the mana is controlled by Int, another 160 by Soul, and the remaining 1280 by Cha.
If your Cha is level 125 when the action is started, the bonus would be sqrt(2.25) = x1.5 so it'd be 1280 / 1.5 = 853.33.
Adding back the 160 from Soul and Int, the total mana the action takes (rounded up) is now 1174, so ~73% of the original mana cost.
The action would give (1600/1174)*(1+sqrt(talent)/2) level exp per mana for the 1174 mana.

haulZ3.label: Haul
haulZ3.tooltip:
You find a strange stones that resists change from the loop. When you move them, they remain in the new location the next time you return. Most of the rocks are just ordinary though. It'll take a while to find the interesting ones.
You're sure you can use them for something. They're too heavy to move more than one at a time though.
One in every thousand Stones is temporal.

haulZ5.label: Haul
haulZ5.tooltip:
You find a strange stones that resists change from the loop. When you move them, they remain in the new location the next time you return. Most of the rocks are just ordinary though. It'll take a while to find the interesting ones.
You're sure you can use them for something. They're too heavy to move more than one at a time though.
One in every thousand Stones is temporal.

haulZ6.label: Haul
haulZ6.tooltip:
You find a strange stones that resists change from the loop. When you move them, they remain in the new location the next time you return. Most of the rocks are just ordinary though. It'll take a while to find the interesting ones.
You're sure you can use them for something. They're too heavy to move more than one at a time though.
One in every thousand Stones is temporal.

look_around.label: Look Around
look_around.tooltip:
It's quite confusing. This place is very small at first, but every time you look around, it becomes bigger.
It's not just space that feels weird, time too : your body feels frozen in time, despite being capable of moving.
• Every % looked at doubles the mana cost of this action.
• For every level of Spirit Blessing, divide the mana cost by 6.
• You need glasses for this action.
• Be careful, you can't gain any exp for the rest of the loop once you set foot in the Squirrel Sanctuary!

absorb_mana.label: Absorb Mana
absorb_mana.info_text3: Mana spots to check if you can absorb them
absorb_mana.tooltip:
As soon as you get the permission to absorb mana, glowing spots appear around you.
You just have to stand in them and you'll absorb an incredible amount of mana. Neat!
You're quite stunned by how much mana there is. Is this place actually made of mana?
• Only 1 in 10 mana spots can be safely absorbed.
• Every mana spot absorbed gives
% more mana than the last.
• This % gets bigger by +0.02 for each level of Spirit Blessing.
• If you absorb a mana spot right now, it'd give
absorb_mana.story_1: Didn't even absorbed a mana spot :⮀ Placeholder.

imbue_squirrel.label: Imbue Squirrel
imbue_squirrel.tooltip:
It looks like the squirrel have a better affinity with magic than you!
Imbuing the squirrel with all the mana you have is quite efficient.
It needs a crazy amount of mana for it, though... Thankfully, that's not a problem here.
• Doing this action will give
imbue_squirrel.tooltip2:
magic exp for the squirrel.
• Every level of Spirit Blessing will make this action 3x more expensive.
• It will also make this action give 4x more magic exp.
imbue_squirrel.story_1: Didn't even made the squirrel imbue anything :⮀ Placeholder.

imbue_soulstones.label: Imbue Stones
imbue_soulstones.tooltip:
You just realized by overcharging your soulstones with mana, they can give off a very small amount of it when needed, once per loop.
This seems like a perfect opportunity to start with more mana!
• You need at least
imbue_soulstones.tooltip2:
soulstones in each stat for this action to work.
• Every level of Spirit Blessing beyond 3 will increase the Soulstones Imbued buff cap by 10.
• The soulstone price of this action gets bigger by 1 for the first 10 times, then 2 for the next 10, then 3,...
imbue_soulstones.story_1: You know this is a placeholder, right? :⮀ Placeholder.

balance_soulstones.label: Balance Stones
balance_soulstones.tooltip:
It can be annoying to get too many soulstones in one stat, and none in another.
So let's rebalance this!
• Takes one soulstone from the stat with the most soulstones and converts it to the stat with the less.
• You can do this action
balance_soulstones.tooltip2:
times per loop.
• Every level of Spirit Blessing will multiply that limit by 3.

mysterious_voice.label: Mysterious Voice
mysterious_voice.requirement_1: First, you need to show yourself. (Just do this action as normal.)
mysterious_voice.requirement_2: Now, show the squirrel. (Do this action in squirrel mode.)
mysterious_voice.requirement_3: Showing 10 stolen goods will probably do the trick for Beginnersville.
mysterious_voice.requirement_4: The forest is filled with magical herbs. Show 100 of them.
mysterious_voice.requirement_5: This is the limit for now, it doesn't go further. Wait for further updates.
mysterious_voice.tooltip:
You faintly hear a mysterious voice that speaks to you...
It says "Show me the world and I will reward you.".
Maybe it'd be worth it to show it a few trinkets from your adventure?
• Every time this action is done, increase the Spirit Blessing buff by one.
• Each time you do this action, the requirement to complete it changes.
•

• Each Spirit Blessing level will accelerate time in the Squirrel Sanctuary by x4, unlock a new action, and strengthen unlocked actions.
• Unlocked at 1% looked around.

wander.label: Wander
wander.tooltip: Explore the town, look for hidden areas and treasures.<hr class='divider'> • 4x progress with glasses.<hr class='divider'>
wander.squirrel_1:
You told the squirrel to wander around for you!
It didn't come back...
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: trust >= 5
wander.squirrel_2:
You told the squirrel to wander around for you!
It came back after a while with a nut in its paws.
...Well, you don't know what you expected.
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 20
wander.squirrel_3:
The squirrel wanders around and comes back with pots you haven't seen before.
Where did it find those?
Effect: Adds 100 new pots to smash. Happens only once.
wander.story_1: 20% Explored:⮀ You know the general layout of the small village now, you don't get lost walking from one side to another!
wander.story_2: 40% Explored:⮀ You're starting to really know your way around, you can almost figure your way around without following a set path!
wander.story_3: 60% Explored:⮀ You've tread all the main roads and you avail yourself to the unkempt side paths and well worn paths. If you let yourself into some houses, well, no one needs to know, do they?
wander.story_4: 80% Explored:⮀ You've decided to explore the houses now that you've trod every single feasible path in this small village. Man, the stuff people keep around.
wander.story_5: 100% Explored:⮀ You've been everywhere, there is absolutely nowhere in this town you haven't been. You've been in every cellar, under every bed, and in every closet. You've pried all the floorboards, and just in general, been into everything. Except the houses with locks, those dastardly locks.

smash_pots.label: Smash Pots
smash_pots.tooltip: They're just sitting there, unbroken, full of potential.<hr class='divider'> • Pots with mana in them have
smash_pots.tooltip2:
mana.
• Every 10 pots have mana.
smash_pots.squirrel_1:
The squirrel tries to break a pot! And another!
You watch in amazement as it fails to break any...
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 10
smash_pots.squirrel_2:
Wait a second, you just realized the squirrel is small enough to go in those pots!
You ask it to go in one. The squirrel goes in it. And doesn't come out.
Upon looking inside, you realize it's trying to grab the mana crystal, but it's too smooth for its paws. Oh well...
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 15
smash_pots.squirrel_3:
Did you just see the squirrel eat a crystal?! And your mana reserve just got bigger too. So that means...
With a grin, you ask the squirrel to go eat all the crystals it can find. It looks like it is faster to gather mana this way than by smashing the pots.
Effect: Smashing pots in squirrel mode takes 20% less mana.
smash_pots.story_1: 50 Pots with mana:⮀ You've smashed every single pot in this village, and have figured out all the pots that contain any trace of mana. Having to break them all physically was time consuming, and your skills at absorbing the mana weren't the best. There must be more efficient ways of doing it.

pet_squirrel.label: Pet Squirrel
pet_squirrel.tooltip:
Wait, you recognize this squirrel! It's the one you tripped on while carrying the loop potion.
Looks like a drop of the looping potion fell on it. It's stuck with you in the time loop, the poor little thing...
• Spend some time with it to increase its trust by 100 exp.
• Doing so recruits the squirrel, it'll fit snuggly in your inventory.
• Every level of trust the squirrel has increases the mana cost of this action by 100.
• Unlocked at 5% explored.
• Try petting the squirrel to get it by your side, then doing the squirrel mode version of this action in the same loop to test its trust, it will eventually be worth it!
• Look at the tooltip of this action in squirrel mode to see what the effects are.
pet_squirrel.squirrel_1:
You ask the squirrel to pet itself. It looks at you with extreme confusion.
Maybe increasing your trust will change the outcome of this action...
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 5
pet_squirrel.squirrel_2:
You ask again the squirrel to pet itself. It still looks confused, but does it. Why is this so cute?!
Surprisingly, at the start of the next loop, it directly jumps on your shoulders. And does it again at the next one.
Neat, it looks like it'll automatically follow you from now on!
Effect: From now on, you will start each loop with the squirrel in your inventory.
Next: trust >= 20
pet_squirrel.squirrel_3:
The squirrel looks definitely fed up with pets right about now!
When you ask it to pet itself, it instead leads you to some sort of playground for pets. What an excellent idea!
Oh uh... Looks like they don't let any random animal here. You're sure with enough reputation, you can convince them to let the squirrel pass.
Effect: Gain 200 trust exp for the fixed cost of 2500 mana. Needs 2 reputation.
pet_squirrel.story_1: Pet the squirrel:⮀ The squirrel hesitantly approaches you... It looks ready to bite you. It also looks all angry and confused. Probably from you tripping on it and the time rewinding every few minutes.
pet_squirrel.story_2: 50 trust:⮀ That's it. You've done it. Now you and the squirrel are the best friends there have ever been. He's ready to sacrifice his life for you and vice-versa.

pick_locks.label: Pick Locks
pick_locks.tooltip: Don't worry; they won't remember.<hr class='divider'> • Valuables looted from houses can be sold to gain
pick_locks.tooltip2:
mana.
• Every 10 houses have valuables.
• Unlocked at 20% Explored.
pick_locks.squirrel_1:
You just thought of a master plan! The squirrel can go in the houses through open windows instead of you needing to pick a lock!
The squirrel follows your direction : after throwing it in an open windows, it put small jewelry in the little bag you gave it.
However, it can't find a way out of the house. Oops. Maybe that wasn't such a master plan...
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: trust >= 7
pick_locks.squirrel_2:
Well, if it can't rob houses, maybe it can use the bag you made differently.
You prepare a small bag with jewelry with a letter glued on it that reads "please buy this for mana"
After sending the squirrel to the merchant, it comes back later with a bunch of mana. Now that's better!
Effect: The valuable you borrow are immediately sold for mana.
pick_locks.story_1: House checked:⮀ You manage to pick a lock that was in disrepair and opened the door, only to walk into the home's inhabitant. Good thing the loop ended not soon after. You're gonna have to figure out which houses are worth hitting. Some money wouldn't go astray.
pick_locks.story_2: 50 Houses known:⮀ You really should look at hitting those locked houses around, who knows what goodies you'll manage to scrounge up.
pick_locks.story_3: 10 Houses with loot:⮀ You've figured out which houses are uninhabited and have enough valuables for it to be worth your time. As they say, time is mana!

take_glasses.label: Take Glasses
take_glasses.tooltip:
You already miss seeing clearly. And there's nowhere to buy new glasses here!
You do remember finding a pair of your prescription during one of your 'house excursions'...
It's alright, you're sure it's a spare one. Probably. Maybe.
• Costs one pile of stolen goods.
• Affects any action with the glasses icon
• Can only have 1 Take Glasses action.
• Unlocked at 20% explored.
take_glasses.squirrel_1:
You put the little toy glasses you found on the squirrel's head.
This is the cutest thing ever!
Effect: None.
take_glasses.story_1: Glasses taken:⮀ The world snaps into sharp focus as you put them on and you gawk a little as details that had slipped your eyes previously stood out in sharp contrast. You're a little gobsmacked at how much of a difference they make.

found_glasses.label: Found Glasses
found_glasses.tooltip:
You could have sworn you had a spare pair of glasses somewhere. Now you've explored to the ends of the world. Every nook or cranny has revealed to you their secrets. And you've found them - in the last place anyone would ever think to look. On top of your head.
You now start all loops with glasses.

buy_mana_z1.label: Buy Mana
buy_mana_z1.tooltip: Nice, there's a shop selling mana here. Lucky you!<hr class='divider'> • 1 gold =
buy_mana_z1.tooltip2:
mana.
• Buys all the mana you can.
• Unlocked at 20% Explored.
buy_mana_z1.squirrel_1:
You gave the squirrel a little bag with a word attached to it asking to buy mana with the gold inside.
A while later, the squirrel comes back with the mana potions.
You're surprised that it worked. Too bad the outcome is the same as you doing it.
Effect: Normal effect.
Next: trust >= 8
buy_mana_z1.squirrel_2:
The mana merchant looks at your squirrel and wants to buy it.
You don't know what to say, so she snatches it out and give you a small mana potion in exchange.
You just get out of the stand a little stunned... At least the squirrel will be back next loop
Effect: Gain 100 extra mana and lose the squirrel.
Next: trust >= 15
buy_mana_z1.squirrel_3:
This time you are prepared, and so is the squirrel.
The squirrel tries its best to seem cute and you bargain with the merchant.
She begrudgingly gives you a lot more mana this time! You and the squirrel both feel proud.
Effect: Gain 1500 extra mana and lose the squirrel.
buy_mana_z1.story_1: Bought Z1 Mana :⮀ Looks like there is a stand selling mana potions. How convenient! It just opened right now. Like, right at the exact time the loop started. You can't help but feel a little uneasy when you think about it...

meet_people.label: Meet People
meet_people.tooltip: They won't let you get away with a simple chat.<hr class='divider'> • Unlocked at 22% Explored.<hr class='divider'>
meet_people.squirrel_1:
It was a mistake. The squirrel kept growling and people don't want to approach you.
Maybe it'll change once it gets more used to people?
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 6
meet_people.squirrel_2:
It was a mistake. People keep being charmed by the squirrel and don't take time to speak to you.
Looks like using the squirrel in this case won't have a positive effect
Effect: None.
meet_people.story_1: 1% People Met:⮀ You stand there, a little stumped at the situation you’ve gotten yourself into, when a young lass asks you about your day so far.
meet_people.story_2: 20% People Met:⮀ The people here are generally nice enough, if a bit brusque at times. Some people have small tasks that they're happy to pay for.
meet_people.story_3: 40% People Met:⮀ There are a surprising amount of people in the village. You didn’t catch that when you were looking around.
meet_people.story_4: 60% People Met:⮀ It almost seems that most people have something they want done, the real problem is figuring out whats worth your time.
meet_people.story_5: 80% People Met:⮀ Having met such a large portion of the people in this village, you almost feel guilty about stealing from them. Almost.
meet_people.story_6: 100% People Met:⮀ You've spoken to everyone. Every child, adult, teen, animal and plant in this village. Everyone, and everything.

train_strength.label: Train Strength
train_strength.tooltip:
Build up those muscles. Again.
• Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset.
• Unlocked at 5% People Met.
train_strength.squirrel_1:
You've never seen a squirrel train its strength so hard!
Too bad it doesn't have any strength stat...
Effect: None.
train_strength.story_1: Strength trained:⮀ You lift the oak barrel filled with water, holding it while you squat again and again. The barrel rests upon your back as you do push up after push up. It's a trusty companion in your quest to regain your muscle.
train_strength.story_2: 100 Strength talent:⮀ Your body adapts faster and faster to the strains you put upon it. You know exactly how far to push it and can tell almost instinctively when to stop.
train_strength.story_3: 1,000 Strength talent:⮀ Your body seems to build itself up faster and faster each time you break it down. You can practically feel your mana purr in satisfaction as it rebuilds your body to be stronger and stronger.

short_quest.label: Short Quest
short_quest.tooltip: Be a hero! ...If the reward is good and it doesn't take too long.<hr class='divider'> • Short Quests with loot give
short_quest.tooltip2:
gold as a reward.
• Every 5 Short Quests have loot.
• Unlocked at 5% People Met.
short_quest.squirrel_1:
The squirrel went and did the quest for you! Well, it tried. And failed.
Maybe because it was supposed to be done by humans...
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 11
short_quest.squirrel_2:
This time, the squirrel tries to help you with the quest! Well, it tried. And failed.
Again, that was probably a bad idea... At least the quest is done this time.
Effect: Normal effects.
Next: trust >= 22
short_quest.squirrel_3:
Maybe if you try from a different angle... You ask the squirrel to charm the quest-giver once you've done all the work.
Surprisingly, it works, and they give you a little bit more money!
Effect: Quests give +10% gold.
short_quest.story_1: Short Quest finished:⮀ You help an elderly woman get her cat down from atop her house, she rewards you handsomely for your efforts.
short_quest.story_2: 20 Short Quests with loot in a loop:⮀ You’ve helped everyone who’s been willing to take you on, and the gold from your work jingles beautifully in your pockets. The satisfaction of a job well done fills you with pride.

investigate.label: Investigate
investigate.tooltip:
You've been hearing some rumors...
• Your stolen valuable might have clues. Adds 20% efficiency for each one you have.
• Unlocked at 25% People Met.
investigate.squirrel_1:
The squirrel goes out and try asking questions to everyone it meets.
Sadly, nobody can understand it... Well, it was worth a try.
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 17
investigate.squirrel_2:
With its small size, the squirrel is able to search more efficiently what you want in the piles of valuables you borrowed.
It makes it slightly faster to investigate them!
Effect: Valuables give +25% efficiency instead of +20%.
investigate.story_1: 20% Investigated:⮀ You catch some snippets of truly interesting gossip. Apparently a Mage and Warrior duo had stopped in and were sticking around for a little while.
investigate.story_2: 40% Investigated:⮀ People are really helpful when you help them, you're almost starting to get a reputation as a busybody around here, but it's offset in that you actually do help people.
investigate.story_3: 60% Investigated:⮀ People are generally more willing to open up if you seem like you know things, and you do know things, as you've been around here awhile now.
investigate.story_4: 80% Investigated:⮀ The villagers are all to happy to share some stories with you at this point, it doesn't hurt that you know a little about most people now and are more than willing to strike up a conversation.
investigate.story_5: 100% Investigated:⮀ You've done it, spoken to everyone in this village. Spent a loop or more on each of them, actually. You know what needs to be done, and at this point you can just go straight there. You can also engineer a situation in which the more stubborn ones will offer you a quest.

long_quest.label: Long Quest
long_quest.tooltip: Be a more impressive hero! ...As long as someone is watching.<hr class='divider'> • Long Quests with loot give
long_quest.tooltip2:
gold and 1 reputation as a reward.
• Every 5 Long Quests have loot.
• Unlocked at 10% Investigated.
long_quest.squirrel_1:
You've seen how badly the squirrel performed for the short quests and you doubt it'd be any better with long quests, but its's worth a try.
Unsurprisingly, it fails. Pretty hard too. Oh well...
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 22
long_quest.squirrel_2:
Charming the quest-givers seems to have worked for the short quests. Let's try it here too!
Well, it only resulted in the quest-giver not paying attention to you, so you didn't gain any reputation. At least you got more gold.
Effect: Quests give +10%, but no reputation.
Next: trust >= 26
long_quest.squirrel_3:
Let's be more tactical about this. You hatch a plan so the squirrel only distracts the quest-giver when it counts.
The plan works, and you get your reputation, this time! You even got a bigger tip! Sweet victory
Effect: Quests give +20% gold.
long_quest.story_1: Long Quest finished:⮀ You cleared out a cellar of rats; there were at least sixty of the blighters. You were rewarded handsomely, and you got a small reputation boost to boot.
long_quest.story_2: 10 Long Quests with loot in a loop:⮀ You’ve cleared out cellars, helped build a house, collected flowers for dyes, worked in the bakery, taken out trash, and helped a seamstress finish a gift for her husband. Your reputation is spreading as the helpful courier. Everyone is at the very least willing to listen to you.

throw_party.label: Throw Party
throw_party.tooltip:
Take a break and socialize.
• Gives people met progress equivalent to 14 Meet People actions.
• Costs 2 reputation.
• Unlocked at 30% Investigated.
throw_party.squirrel_1:
It looks like words about you having a cute squirrel have reached more ears than you thought.
There's more people in the party than usual, sweet!
Effect: Gives people met progress equivalent to 18 Meet People actions.
Next: trust >= 27
throw_party.squirrel_2:
Your squirrel finally trusts you enough to chase itself that wild squirrel that was causing problems at the parties without any hint of hesitation.
People seems relieved, and they start talking to you about their squirrel-related problems, and how they couldn't dare tell you about them because you had a pet one.
You never knew you could learn about so many new quests at once!
Effect: Gain 20 more short quests and 10 more long quests. This effect can only be done once. Still gives 18 Meet People action.
throw_party.story_1: Party thrown:⮀ You announce that its your birthday and you want to throw a party. You commandeer the village square and the people necessary to make it happen. You don't have the gold but people aren't quite able to say no. You promise you'll pay it off with the money from this current job.

warrior_lessons.label: Warrior Lessons
warrior_lessons.tooltip:
Learning to fight is probably important; you have a long journey ahead of you.
• Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
• Unlocked at 20% Investigated.
warrior_lessons.squirrel_1:
You present your squirrel to the warrior! She looks at you confused.
You don't know what you expected.
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 24
warrior_lessons.squirrel_2:
The squirrel wants to help you! It offers being a target for your training. It worked quite well, you learned a lot more from this!
... For some unrelated reasons, you lose your squirrel for the rest of the loop.
Effect: Gives 300 combat exp, but lose the squirrel.
warrior_lessons.story_1: 1 Combat:⮀ You manage to track down the warrior that was staying in town, and are greeted by a small woman holding a sword almost as tall as her. She introduces herself as "Iron" and smiles politely, doesn't stop her from thoroughly trouncing you.
warrior_lessons.story_2: 100 Combat:⮀ You manage to give Iron a run for her money, but she still manages to eek out a victory, she's noticeably worn out afterwards.
warrior_lessons.story_3: 200 Combat:⮀ You push Iron to the brink of defeat and then she starts fighting dirty.
warrior_lessons.story_4: 250 Combat:⮀ You manage to finally defeat Iron, all your experience fighting her finally pays off. You feel really proud of yourself, right up until she smacks your head with her sword and demands a rematch.

mage_lessons.label: Mage Lessons
mage_lessons.tooltip:
The mystic got you into this mess, maybe it can help you get out of it.
• Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
• Unlocked at 20% Investigated.
mage_lessons.squirrel_1:
You present your squirrel to the mage! He immediately falls in love with it and plays with it for the rest of the lesson.
You learned nothing because of this.
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 24
mage_lessons.squirrel_2:
You promise to lend your squirrel to the mage if he does his best during this lesson. The mage happily agrees.
You learned so much more during this lesson!
Effect: Gives 300 magic exp, but lose the squirrel.
mage_lessons.story_1: 1 Magic:⮀ You approach a burly man dressed in flowing robes, and ask if he would be willing to teach you some magic. The man agrees to teach you some basic cantrips if you help him out with menial tasks. He introduces himself as Warrick.
mage_lessons.story_2: 100 Magic:⮀ Warrick compliments you on your ability to wield mana, and is happy to share some more dangerous cantrips with your promise to not use it for ill. He refuses to teach you about alchemy.
mage_lessons.story_3: 200 Magic:⮀ Warrick is suspicious about your proficiency with mana for someone he's just run into in the wild, but is still more than willing to humor you. If he throws appraising glances at you every now and then, you pay them no mind.
mage_lessons.story_4: 250 Magic:⮀ You and Warrick duel, your lessons from that point on are finding an out of the way location and duking it out with magic. Warrick seems appreciative about the exertion.
mage_lessons.story_5: 10 Alchemy:⮀ You offer to help him with his alchemy work and he immdiately seems to develop a soft spot for you, talking about herbs and their effects when combined with eachother and how they build together to create mystical potions. The man's passionate, that's for sure.
mage_lessons.story_6: 50 Alchemy:⮀ You offer Warrick some alchemy techniques that he's never heard of in exchange for some more magic techniques and lessons. He agrees readily.
mage_lessons.story_7: 100 Alchemy:⮀ You offer to teach Warrick about alchemy if he teaches you about the branches of magic you have little grounding in. The man himself is a genius and has much to teach. He gives it his all, tempted by the secrets of Alchemy.

heal_the_sick.label: Heal The Sick
heal_the_sick.tooltip:
You won't be able to heal them all, but they'll be thankful for doing what you can.
• Healing is always 3 parts, each with a main stat - Diagnose (Per), Treat (Int), Inform (Cha).
• Gives (magic skill) * (restoration skill / 50) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 100) progress points per mana.
• Gives 3 reputation and 50 magic exp upon patient completion.
• Requires a reputation of 1 or above.
• Unlocked at 12 Magic skill.
heal_the_sick.squirrel_1:
The squirrel wants to heal people too! He tries and... looks completely at a loss over what to do.
At least he tried, right?
Effect: None.
heal_the_sick.story_1: Patient healed:⮀ You're allowed in to see the patients and begin healing. It's excellent practice and everyone you heal, be it from broken bones to small scrapes is extraordinarily thankful for your help.
heal_the_sick.story_2: 10 Patients healed in a loop:⮀ Your reputation is absolutely sterling, you've basically cleared out the entire healing home and the nurses and healers are more than thankful for your help.
heal_the_sick.story_3: Failed Action:⮀ You're turned away at the door, the small healers home stating that they can't trust you to not poison the people inside or make the situation worse.

fight_monsters.label: Fight Monsters
fight_monsters.tooltip:
Slowly, you're figuring out their patterns.
• Fighting rotates between 3 types of battles, each with a main stat - Quick (Spd), Defensive (Str), Aggressive (Con).
• Gives (self combat) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 100) progress points per mana.
• Gives 50 combat exp and 20 gold per fight segment completion.
• Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
• Unlocked at 10 Combat skill.

fight_monsters.squirrel_1:
The squirrel looks ready to fight! So you throw it on a monster.
... Maybe it's better to not describe what happens next.
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
fight_monsters.story_1: Monster killed:⮀ It's all so new, the way they respond and attack, you're not ashamed to admit that you almost got brained by a deer. Either way, their hides and rendered components will sell well.
fight_monsters.story_2: 100 Monsters killed:⮀ You've fought enough that you're really starting to figure out how they'll respond to most things.
fight_monsters.story_3: 500 Monsters killed:⮀ You've pretty much figured out their patterns now, how they respond to what you do.
fight_monsters.story_4: 1,000 Monsters killed:⮀ You know exactly what they're going to do, pretty much nothing surprises you anymore.
fight_monsters.story_5: 5,000 Monsters killed:⮀ You're able to effectively plan ambushes and set traps to kill them without even being there anymore.
fight_monsters.story_6: 10,000 Monsters killed:⮀ You don't struggle or need to worry about anything they throw at you anymore, you know everything.
fight_monsters.story_7: 20,000 Monsters killed:⮀ This is a joke, the only reason you're still doing this is the gold it rakes in. You need it.

magic_fighter.label: Magic Fighter
magic_fighter.tooltip:
You might learn a lot from fighting this insanely strong looking magic fighter.
Looks like he's about to leave, though, so you only have the time do it once.
You have the feeling you're not supposed to meet him so early...
• This should be available later in the run, but you're free to fight him right now for a challenge.
• Every completed segment gives 50 magic and combat exp. Managing to land a hit will give you an extra 50 exp.
• Gives (magic + self combat) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + attacks landed / 100) progress points per mana.
• Can only be done once per loop.
• To beat him, you have to hit him four times!
• Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
• Unlocked at a combined Combat and Magic skill of 25.

part_names.name_1: Magic Fighter : Barely Moving A Muscle

segment_names.name: Resisting intimidation
Preparing an attack plan
Observing movements
Dodging attacks
Parrying attacks
Getting out of the spell's area of effect
Making a distraction
Waiting for an opening
Striking with all might

magic_fighter.squirrel_1:
The magic fighter looks at you with incredulity. Did you just ask him to fight a squirrel?
Seeing how he ignores you for the rest of the loop, you think he didn't take it well.
Effect: None.
magic_fighter.story_1: Attempted to fight:⮀ The magic fighter sighs and asks you try your best. It looks like this isn't the first time someone asked him this. Before you take your first step, you're already on the ground, defeated. This isn't going to be easy...

small_dungeon.label: Small Dungeon
small_dungeon.tooltip:
There are small changes each time; it's harder to get used to.
The soulstones at the end last through loops, but they're not always in the dungeon... Strange.
• The dungeon requires different skills at different points.
• One action can clear multiple floors if your stats are high enough.
• Gives (magic + self combat) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times floor completed / 200) progress points per mana.
• Gives 100 magic and combat exp per completion. It gives 1 soulstone as well - hover over Looted for info.
• Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
• Unlocked at a combined Combat and Magic skill of 35.
small_dungeon.completed_tooltip:
Each soulstone improves a random stat's exp gain by (1+(soulstones)^.7/10).
Each floor has a soulstone that, when received, reduces the chance you'll get the next one by 2%.
Chance to receive a soulstone recovers per floor at 0.00001% per mana.
small_dungeon.squirrel_1:
You don't think it's a good idea, but the squirrel seems to want to go the dungeon.
Ah, wait, no, he just wanted the nuts that were in front of the door. Nevermind, then.
Effect: None.
small_dungeon.story_1: Small dungeon attempted:⮀ The cavernous entrance to the villages dungeon greets you. It's dark and looming, with rocks forming jagged fangs. It's the most imposing thing you've found in this town so far.
small_dungeon.story_2: 1,000 Dungeon floors looted:⮀ You know your way around the dungeon like no one else, almost as if you've explored every nook and cranny. You have.
small_dungeon.story_3: 5,000 Dungeon floors looted:⮀ The dungeon poses less and less of a threat to you each time you conquer it, the soulstones growing your power by small amounts now that you've accumulated so many of them.
small_dungeon.story_4: 10,000 Dungeon floors looted:⮀ The dungeon is a joke to you, if you could teleport you'd simply jump straight to them, the dungeon in your mind has been reduced to how short it is to get from one soulstone to the next. If you have to destroy a couple walls, so be it.
small_dungeon.story_5: 6 Floors cleared in a loop:⮀ You reach the actual end of the dungeon, the dungeon core glows an angry red as if irritated that you're at this floor at all. Regardless, you take your soulstone and leave, the dungeon core's red glow following you the whole time.

buy_supplies.label: Buy Supplies
buy_supplies.tooltip: Prepare to move on.<hr class='divider'> • Costs
buy_supplies.tooltip2:
gold.
• You only need one set of supplies.
buy_supplies.squirrel_1:
Maybe you could use the squirrel for a discount? You ask it to act cute in front of the shopkeep.
Both the squirrel and the shopkeep look at you with a grave look.
Oh, right, you need to use the haggle action if you want a discount.
Effect: None.
buy_supplies.story_1: Supplies bought:⮀ A tent, enough rations to last for a month, portable cooking equipment and other assorted paraphernalia for your trip. The tent is durable and the rations don't taste bland and lifeless. It was probably worth the 450 gold asking price. Good thing you knew how to haggle.
buy_supplies.story_2: Supplies bought without haggling:⮀ How luxurious! You had the gold to just throw it away now, even though the mana would've been more beneficial in the long run, not having to haggle once in awhile was surprisingly nice. Truly, you have grown luxuriant.

haggle.label: Haggle
haggle.tooltip:
They won't like you as much, but hey - you're leaving.
• Costs 1 reputation to reduce the price of supplies by 30.
• Unlocked at a combined Combat and Magic skill of 35.
haggle.squirrel_1:
Until now, the squirrel acting cute worked pretty much every time. Time to get a discount with it!
... Well, you just learned the merchant dislikes squirrels. Oops?
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 30
haggle.squirrel_2:
You devise a plan with the squirrel to maximise its cuteness in the hope it would still soften the shopkeep.
After a lot of work and tries, it works! But with how difficult that was, you're sure it won't work again...
Effect: Reduce the price of supplies by 30 without losing any reputation. Can only be done once per loop.
haggle.story_1: Haggle:⮀ The shopkeep has some of the supplies you need, but they are of inferior quality and you're not paying his asking price for them, at least that's what you tell him. You argue, grumble, make sharp comments and are just in general unpleasant to one another.
haggle.story_2: 15 Haggles in a loop:⮀ The shopkeep basically throws you out the store shouting and cursing vociferously at you. You ears ring slightly at the barrage.
haggle.story_3: 16 Haggles in a loop:⮀ At this point, it served no purpose, you were doing this solely for the fun of it. No matter how much you haggled, the merchant wasn't going to pay you to take the supplies. That was just wishful thinking. Although, losing the reputation you had accrued could be useful in the long run...

start_journey.label: Start Journey
start_journey.tooltip:
Follow the trail to end up at the next town. You need to keep moving until you can learn how to shut these loops off.
• Costs 1 supplies.
• Finish once to unlock Forest Path's actions, then finish this in order to use Forest Path's actions.
• Unlocked at a combined Combat and Magic skill of 35.
• Warning : the next zone isn't finished. Like at all. Getting further will only give you an extremely unbalanced gameplay that will give you a taste of what's to come.
Please, please back up your save before going further! There's even the risk your savefile could be corrupted if you go further.
If you want to see how far in development the next zone is, look at the changelog!
start_journey.squirrel_1:
The squirrel asks you to follow it, then stops. It looks extremely torn. Looks like it doesn't trust you enough yet for it to reveal where it wanted to go...
Seeing how it's reacting, you're sure it's something extremely valuable. You have to gain more trust!
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 28
start_journey.squirrel_2:
The squirrel asks you to follow it. It's leading you out of the village, in the opposite direction from the forest.
Just where is it leading you?
Note : The new zone unlocked isn't finished yet. Look at the warning in human mode to know what to do!
Effect: Go to a new zone.
start_journey.story_1: Traveled to the second zone:⮀ You leave town, heading towards the forest that stood between the village and Merchanton. You had exhausted every option in Beginnersville and there was nothing here that would stop the loops, it was time to look for other areas and solutions.

hitch_ride.label: Hitch Ride
hitch_ride.tooltip:
The explorers guild has a contract with various caravaans for transport around the world. They have taught you the secret handsigns to gain passage. And this one just happens to have some spare mana to share on the journey!
Travels to Merchanton.

open_rift.label: Open Rift
open_rift.tooltip:
Using your vast knowledge of the dark arts, you can open a rift into the shadow realm to send you straight to Startington.
Unfortunately, it doesn't seem like you can fit any supplies through the rift.
Unlocked at 300 Dark Magic and 100 Spatiomancy.

explore_forest.label: Explore Forest
explore_forest.tooltip: What a pleasant area.<hr class='divider'> • 4x progress with glasses.<hr class='divider'>
explore_forest.story_1: 1% Forest explored:⮀ You look at the side of the path from your little campsite, and are struck with a sense of wanderlust. You leave your camp to explore. Not too far from your campsite you find a tiny glade practically overflowing with mana.
explore_forest.story_2: 10% Forest explored:⮀ The sense of wanderlust hasn't faded but you've definitely discovered the darker side of this forest. You continue to find tiny glades filled with mana throughout the forest.
explore_forest.story_3: 20% Forest explored:⮀ You were exploring the forest when you found what looked like game trails but was actually a footpath worn into the ground, you decided to follow it.
explore_forest.story_4: 40% Forest explored:⮀ You continue exploring the forest, and you've discovered something odd about it. One side of the main path is... calm you suppose, peaceful even. Welcoming. The other makes you feel ill at ease, as if there are unseen eyes constantly on you. One side is light and airy, the other dark and gloomy.
explore_forest.story_5: 50% Forest explored:⮀ You found flowers in the forest, growing in the almost pitch black beneath the thick canopy on the gloomy side of the forest. Yet the flowers grow. There's a desire to follow them, almost as if they're saying, "Follow Me!"
explore_forest.story_6: 60% Forest explored:⮀ You continue searching around the forest, finding tracks and trails, boltholes and hollowed out tree trunks. Life is abundant in this forest, and you're seeing that. On both sides.
explore_forest.story_7: 80% Forest explored:⮀ You've managed to figure out where most of the herds in this forest are during your trip through, you've also stumbled across a fair amount of plants that produce mana, you wonder if they have a use.
explore_forest.story_8: 100% Forest explored:⮀ You've done it, you find it impossible to get lost in the forest now, and your sense of wanderlust has faded. You've seen practically all you can in this forest. There were areas barred to you, and you found no way to enter them with a cursory examination.
explore_forest.squirrel_1:
A new zone, finally! You spent an eternity in Beginnersville, you and the squirrel are both excited about exploring this new place!
Actually, it's so excited it looks like it wants to explore things on its own then come back to you.
Oh well, why not?
Except there's a slight problem... No matter how much you wait, it isn't coming back.
You're pretty sure it got lost... Ah well, you'll see it back next loop, so it's not that big of a problem.
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: trust >= 32
explore_forest.squirrel_2:
This time, you decide to not take any risk and not split up with the squirrel.
And it was the right call! It's really thorough with its exploration.
It manages to find in places you already went a few magical herbs here and there you missed. Good!
Effect: Gain 200 more herbs. This effect can only be done once.
Next: trust >= 36
explore_forest.squirrel_3:
The squirrel found a lot of herbs last time, so you have high hope this time!
After a while, seeing how it hasn't found anything, you can't help but feel disappointed...
The squirrel, seeing your disappointed looks, goes into overdrive and starts furrowing the ground everywhere.
After a while, he comes back to you with a smug look, pointing at some mana spots he dug out.
This is the best friend you could ever ask for!
Effect: Gain 100 more mana spots. This effect can only be done once.

wild_mana.label: Wild Mana
wild_mana.tooltip: They're out of sight of most travellers, but you have time to find and harvest them.<hr class='divider'> • Every good mana spot has
wild_mana.tooltip2:
mana.
• Every 10 mana spots have good mana.
wild_mana.squirrel_1:
A new way to get mana! You wonder if asking the squirrel to do it for you will change anything.
... Turns out, it's exactly the same. It was worth a try.
Effect: Normal effect.
Next: squirrel magic >= 15
wild_mana.squirrel_2:
The squirrel keeps insisting gathering mana for you again, so you let it do it.
Oh! With its new magic senses, it is capable of absorbing the mana in a more efficicent way!
Thank you, squirrel!
Effect: Mana spots give 100 extra mana.
Next: squirrel combat >= 25
wild_mana.squirrel_3:
Well well... Thanks to the squirrel, you just discovered shredding the mana spots to pieces is quite useful.
It's way quicker to absorb mana this way, but it also means they are unable to replenish anymore...
Ah well, they will come back next loop, so it shouldn't be a problem!
Effect: In addition of giving 100 extra mana, it takes 15% less time to do this action.
wild_mana.story_1: Source checked for mana:⮀ It's just sitting there, stray slightly from the beaten path and you find an abundance of mana just waiting for someone to take it, the only catch being you need to extract it from the plants surrounding it and they've proven slightly unwilling to part with it.

gather_herbs.label: Gather Herbs
gather_herbs.tooltip:
Might as well dig up anything useful you find.
• Every 10 funny plants are herbs.
• Unlocked at 10% Forest Explored.
gather_herbs.squirrel_1:
If those herbs really have magic inside, eating them will probably give you some mana...
So you ask the squirrel to eat them instead of picking them up.
It looks at you with doubtful eyes. Then shakes its head. Maybe he thinks they are poisonous to squirrels?
You think they aren't, but you can't really convey that to the squirrel.
Well, it looks like it won't eat it until it trusts you enough for that, in any case.
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 34
gather_herbs.squirrel_2:
Finally, the squirrel trusts you enough to eat those herbs!
It looks like they aren't poisonous to squirrels in the end! Not that you ever doubted it. Erm...
You finally see the results, and... they give less mana than the squirrel needs to eat them.
Talk about a waste...
Effect: Consume one herb instead of gathering it to gain 200 mana.
Next: magic >= 35
gather_herbs.squirrel_3:
Something changed... It looks like the herbs give more mana now?
It has probably something to do with the new magical power the squirrel have.
Also, it looks like the squirrel now got hooked on them... Are they that tasty?
You're tempted to try, but... maybe another day?
Effect: Consume one herb instead of gathering it to gain 250 mana.
gather_herbs.story_1: Plant checked for use:⮀ You pull up random plants across the forest that emanate mana only to find that in most cases, they're simply plants that have started gathering mana, but in some cases they're actually magical plants. Small distinction, but a significant one.

hunt.label: Hunt
hunt.tooltip:
The forest provides.
• Every 10 animals have good hides.
• Unlocked at 40% Animals Feed.
hunt.squirrel_1:
The squirrel wants to hunt the animals for you!
That's sweet, but... You can't help but feel a bit worried about it.
It doesn't wait for your approval, and goes attacking a pack of animals at once.
Well, uh... next time's the charm, maybe?
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: squirrel combat >= 50
hunt.squirrel_2:
Now that the squirrel is quite strong, it might be a good idea to attempt this again.
And it works! It goes attacking the same pack of animals and completely decimate them.
It's a bit too gory for your taste, but it works...
Suprisingly, the squirrel is even better at you at hunting animals!
You feel proud : training it for all this time was very worth it!
Effect: Hunting with the squirrel takes 20% less mana.
hunt.story_1: Animal checked for hide:⮀ You manage to track down a relatively harmless animal, but in the time it took you to bring the critter down you had ruined its pelt beyond all use. You needed practice.
hunt.story_2: 10 Animals with hide:⮀ You ghost through the forest, targeting packs that you know graze or are moving through locations easily reached and ambushed. You're starting to get good at this tracking thing, but you suppose you only really have to do it once.
hunt.story_3: 20 Animals with hide:⮀ A deer languishes by the water, lapping gently at the water seemingly unaware of your presence. It remains unaware of your presence as you slowly edge closer, the deer remains unaware of your presence until it is unaware of everything forevermore. You ghost through the forest on silent feet, swift as the wind and as deadly as a viper, your body swaying as you slip between blind spots and perception to reach your targets. The animals feel nothing as they die, you've had much practice. You offer a silent thanks as their pelts will be of value to you.

sit_by_waterfall.label: Sit By Waterfall
sit_by_waterfall.tooltip:
It's peaceful here. Loud, but peaceful.
• Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset.
• Unlocked at 70% Forest Explored.
sit_by_waterfall.squirrel_1:
The squirrel wants to sit under the waterfall!
Why not? It might be fun for it to sit there.
... After a while, it starts sneezing. Oh no, it caught a cold!
You take it back with you. Poor little critter!
In that state, it's probably not good to let it do any other action until next loop...
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
sit_by_waterfall.story_1: Sat by waterfall:⮀ You find a waterfall flowing from a higher point in a mountain down the side oddly scenic and decide stop to stare for awhile, simply to observe the natural beauty of the sight. As you watched, the force of the water managed to dislodge a small pebble from the top of the waterfall and send it careening down. You watch oddly mesmerized at it bounces along the path, constantly being immersed and spat out by the water. You don't know when you sat down and began meditating, only that you woke from your deep realization hours later.

old_shortcut.label: Old Shortcut
old_shortcut.tooltip:
No one has come down this way in quite some time.
• Gives some additional herbs.
• Old men are a pain unless you know something they care about.
Talk to Hermit gives 3% more Hermit Knowledge Learned per 1% Shortcut Explored.
• Unlocked at 20% Forest Explored.
old_shortcut.squirrel_1:
The squirrel feels pretty confident it won't get lost this time, exploring this place!
... Aaaand it got lost again. Gosh darn it.
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: squirrel magic >= 5
old_shortcut.squirrel_2:
Using its new magic skills, the squirrel manages to not get lost this time!
Apparently, something about these shortcuts radiates a small amount of magic.
The hermit talked about this magic : its knowledge should be quite helpful for the squirrel.
Effect: Talk to Hermit gives a 4% bonus to this action instead of 3%.
Next: squirrel magic >= 25
old_shortcut.squirrel_3:
Now that the squirrel has a better handle on his magic skills, he is even better at exploring shortcuts!
Who knew having a magic squirrel could be so handy?
You can't help but reward it with a nut. It makes a little happy dance!
Effect: Talk to Hermit gives a 5% bonus to this action instead of 3%.
old_shortcut.story_1: 1% Shortcut explored:⮀ You continued on with your trip and discovered a small and worn path leading off the main thoroughfare. You wondered what it was and decided to explore.
old_shortcut.story_2: 10% Shortcut explored:⮀ You're mildly surprised to discover a seemingly sprawling network of interconnected paths that seem to get almost everywhere within the forest.
old_shortcut.story_3: 20% Shortcut explored:⮀ You stumble across a small clearing in the forest, racks of drying herbs and bubbling cauldrons litter the clearing. As soon as you step in, a hermit leaps from his hut yelling at you.
old_shortcut.story_4: 40% Shortcut explored:⮀ You continue to explore the shortcuts, you're able to recognize where you are in the sprawling network with a glance. You're able to move freely around the forest.
old_shortcut.story_5: 60% Shortcut explored:⮀ You've discovered another set of hidden shortcuts on the gloomy side of the forest, and set about exploring them, they seem less looked after than those on the other side, but are still serviceable.
old_shortcut.story_6: 80% Shortcut explored:⮀ These old shortcuts are incredible, they almost seem to tell a story of when this forest was more habitable. You wonder why they were forgotten.
old_shortcut.story_7: 100% Shortcut explored:⮀ You dust your hands and smile contently, you've done it. You've traveled every single path to completion. You could start at a completely random point and find your way out. That old hermit seems to like these paths.

talk_to_hermit.label: Talk To Hermit
talk_to_hermit.tooltip:
This old man is happy to have a listening ear, surely he has some useful knowledge. You hope. He's initially confrontational, but opens up once you start talking about the road.
• Reduces mana cost of Gather Herbs, Practice Yang, and Learn Alchemy by 0.5% per 1% of Hermit Knowledge.
• His knowledge about shortcuts also gives 3% more Old Shortcut speed per 1% Hermit Knowledge Learned.
• Unlocked with both 20% Shortcut Explored and 40 Magic.
talk_to_hermit.squirrel_1:
In Beginnersville, using the squirrel charms was quite useful, so let's try it here!
You ask the squirrel to make its best at looking cute while you talk to the hermit.
The moment you turn your back, you hear some sort of high pitch muffling sound?
It looks like the squirrel is gone now.
Where did it go?
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: squirrel combat >= 8
talk_to_hermit.squirrel_2:
You decide to try again at charming the hermit with the squirrel.
The moment you turn your back, you hear the hermit screaming "OW!".
Oh, he has a little bite mark on his hand now. Weird!
Effect: Old Shortcut gives a 4% bonus to this action instead of 3%.
Next: squirrel combat >= 30
talk_to_hermit.squirrel_3:
This time, the hermit screams louder and has multiple bite marks on his hand.
He really is on his guard about something, which helps lowering it guard against you.
You don't really understand whats happening, but now he's easier to talk to, so yay!
Effect: Old Shortcut gives a 5% bonus to this action instead of 3%.
talk_to_hermit.story_1: 1% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ The Hermit is old, scraggly and surprisingly, not bald. Looks old as dirt. He doesn't know the name of the surrounding provinces, but knows the names of the provinces before the current ones.
talk_to_hermit.story_2: 10% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ The old hermit is an absolute genius at using magic to speed things up and just in general make things quicker and easier. You have much information to wring from him. He doesn't tell you his name and insists you call him 'Old man', or 'Hermit'.
talk_to_hermit.story_3: 20% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ He still hasn't told you his name and you've tried to worm it out of him over multiple loops. He just seems amused at your attempts. Either way, you're steadily wringing out more information from him.
talk_to_hermit.story_4: 40% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ Apparently, the old man was here before this forest was a forest. He remembers the first seeds being sown. Just, what? How old would that even make him?
talk_to_hermit.story_5: 60% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ You learn more about his tells, when to push and when not to. You've angered him and seen him joyful, made him laugh and cry. Reminisce on old memories and curse bitterly. You've almost figured him out. You still don't know his name.
talk_to_hermit.story_6: 80% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ You've spent more time learning about this one man than you have most other things, you've come to see him almost as a familiar figure. With how much time you've spent with him, it's hard not to. You still don't know his name. One thing you do know is that he's been around a long time and has forgotten more about magic than you've learned.
talk_to_hermit.story_7: 100% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ He finally told you his name. Gelt. He seemed almost knowing as he told you.

practice_yang.label: Practice Yang
practice_yang.tooltip:
It looks like being alone for so long made the hermit practice some kind of weird but useful magic. It's like pulling teeth getting this knowledge from the Hermit, though.
• Gives 25 more yang exp per reputation you have.
• Unlocked with both 20% Hermit Knowledge and 45 magic.
practice_yang.squirrel_1:
Before starting practicing Yang, the hermit asks you to hand over the squirrel.
He says that he will be really grateful for it, and that it'll help you with practicing Yang.
But the squirrel shakes its head, as if to say no.
You're curious about what would happen, but as long as the squirrel is against it, you can't really say yes...
Effect: None.
Next: trust >= 38
practice_yang.squirrel_2:
As usual, the hermit asks you to hand over the squirrel.
You wait for the squirrel to say no as usual, but instead, it looks pensive.
It looks like it really wants to help you, so it's ready to take the bullet!
You accept the offer and hand over the squirrel. You can't help wondering about what will happen to it...
All you know is that at the start of the next loop, the squirrel looks pretty happy...
No, seriously, what happened?!.
Effect: Gain 4 reputation but lose the squirrel.

learn_alchemy.label: Learn Alchemy
learn_alchemy.tooltip:
You can listen to him yammer while making light healing and remedy potions.
• You're starting to think the potion that caused you to loop time was a complex one.
You provide the ingredients; costs 10 herbs.
• Use what you learned from brewing to make this action more efficient.
• Gain 10 more exp per Brewing level, up to 10 times, then gain 10 exp every 2 levels, then every 3 levels,...
• Unlocked with both 40% Hermit Knowledge and 50 Magic.
learn_alchemy.squirrel_1:
Despite how much the squirrel is willing to learn... It's still a squirrel.
And complex equations are quite hard for it to understand.
Maybe by training another set of skills will it be able to understand it?
Effect: None.
learn_alchemy.story_1: Alchemy learned:⮀ You ask the hermit about potion's and are regaled of tales from his time as an apprentice, the mistakes he made and how one time, he managed to douse his masters beard with potion that would wildly change the color of it every minute, for a full year his master had to deal with a beard that was either glowing white like pure fallen snow or was more fit to be in the sky after rain. You take notes as the hermit speaks.
learn_alchemy.story_2: 25 Alchemy:⮀ You sit by the fire inside the hermits clearing, fire dancing merrily away as he feeds magical herbs to the fire while throwing precise amounts into the large pot boiling above it. The stories he tells of his youth and learning alchemy under his master make you howl with laughter and provoke deep thoughtful silences.
learn_alchemy.story_3: 50 Alchemy:⮀ As you learn more and more about alchemy, the potion that caused you to start looping begins to seem more and more hideously complex. Something as simple as your reputation can effect the outcome of a potion. It's more of an art than a science, or anything even easily conveyed really.

distill_potions.label: Distill Potions

segment_names.name: Writing a formula
Using the right dosage
Waiting and hoping it doesn't explode

distill_potions.tooltip:
Bubbles and Flasks. Potions and Magic.
• Requires a reputation of 10 or above, or he won't let you near his stuff.
• Gives (alchemy + brewing/2) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + potions distilled / 100) progress points per mana.
• Creates a potion from 10 herbs to sell at the next town.
• Unlocked with 10 Alchemy.
distill_potions.story_1: Potion brewed:⮀ The old man happily lets you use his apparatus to brew your own potions after much haranguing about your technique and the fact that you're not buying ingredients off him, he leaves you to it. His workstations are old, well used and obviously well looked after. The only fault you can lay at their feet is that the measuring system used is older than dirt. Fits you suppose.
distill_potions.story_2: Action failed with low reputation:⮀ The hermit refuses to allow you near his workstations and potion brewing equipment no matter how much you ask and offer to pay. He tells you that you don't have a good enough karma for him to even be willing to risk you using his workstations and potion benches.
distill_potions.story_3: Action failed with negative reputation:⮀ The hermit shoos you away from his clearing when you even make a mention of using his potion supplies, something about not wanting you to taint his equipment with your karma.
distill_potions.squirrel_1:
You have to admit, it's quite funny looking at the squirrel trying to grab flasks!
Without any opposible thumbs, it's quite hard to grab anything.
The hermit is less happy about seeing flasks being broken right and left, though...
Effect: None.

train_squirrel.label: Train Squirrel
train_squirrel.tooltip: This is the perfect place to train your squirrel! You prepare a little training arena with branches, and a nut to punch.<hr class='divider'> • Gives Self Combat x 4 =
train_squirrel.tooltip2:
squirrel combat exp per action.
• Unlocked at 30% Forest Explored.
train_squirrel.squirrel_1:
Instead of being trained by you, the squirrel wants to try to train by itself!
So it runs towards an animal to fight it, and...
Yeah, no, this was a bad idea.
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: squirrel combat >= 5
train_squirrel.squirrel_2:
Alright, now that the squirrel have learn its lesson, it decides to go against an animal of around the same strenght as itself.
This time, he manages to beat it! What a strong squirrel!
Instead of stopping there, it goes against another... And then against another...
Until it fails. Well, at least it learned a lot from this!
Effect: Gain Squirrel Combat Level x 10 combat exp, but lose the squirrel.

feed_animals.label: Feed Animals
feed_animals.tooltip:
Feed wild animals and they will show you ressources scattered around the forest. They sure do like magical herbs!
• The more herbs you have, the easier they will approach you :
• Every herb you have gives a +2% efficiency.
• If you don't have the squirrel at the start of each loop yet, now it will join you.
• Consumes 10 herbs per action.
• Unlocked at 40% Forest Explored.
feed_animals.squirrel_1:
Upon feeding some animals, a bunch of wild squirrels appear.
Your squirrel wants to go with them!
You can't refuse that, can you?
Let it go on a squirrel adventure with squirrel friends!
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: squirrel combat >= 18
feed_animals.squirrel_2:
It looks like your squirrel was able to go in a squirrel dungeon with its squirrel friends.
It got a little map that points out some wild mana spots hidden in the forest.
That's some great loot! You pet the squirrel and let it go for new squirrel adventures!
Effect: Gain 100 more mana spots. This effect can only be done once. Lose the squirrel.
Next: squirrel combat >= 40
feed_animals.squirrel_3:
Even more loot! Looks like your squirrel and its friends have conquered the 2 squirrel dungeons in this forest.
This little map points out a stack of hidden magical herbs this time. Great!
While there's not much to gain from this anymore, you still let your squirrel go away.
It'll probably go drink some squirrel beers with its squirrel friends while you finish the loop!
Effect: Gain 200 more herbs. This effect can only be done once. Lose the squirrel.

pot_fairy.label: Mana Pot Fairy
pot_fairy.tooltip:
Deep in the forest, you discover an old shrine...
• If you broke any pots or took a mana crystal from them this loop, she will curse you and render your reputation negative.
• If you didn't break any pots, she will bless you and give you 2000 mana and 1 reputation per 10 mana pots discovered.
• Unlocked at 10% Animals Fed.
pot_fairy.squirrel_1:
Your squirrel decides to go see the fairy before you do.
Despite its efforts to communicate, the fairy ignores it.
How rude!
Effect: None.
Next: squirrel magic >= 20
pot_fairy.squirrel_2:
Something is wrong... The fairy emits a lot of mana, but a good part comes from another place.
Your squirrel decides to investigate and find another fairy!
It's the magical herb fairy, the daughter of the mana pot fairy.
Now that you know she's here, she's ready to pick up herbs for you... If you don't anger her mother.
Effect: If the fairy blesses you, picks up 100 magical herbs for you.
Next: squirrel magic >= 40
pot_fairy.squirrel_3:
Using its own magical power, the squirrel is able to strenghten the magical herb fairy!
Uh oh, looks like injecting magical power into a fairy is seen by them as a big romantic thing.
Now she has a crush on your squirrel... You're not sure if it's a good or a bad thing?
Anyway, now she shouldn't have any issue picking up all the herbs you have found. Awesome!
Effect: If the fairy blesses you, picks up all magical herbs you have found.
Next: magic >= 40

burn_forest.label: Burn Forest

segment_names.name: Searching for dry wood
Setting it on fire using a stick

burn_forest.tooltip:
It's good to let loose, sometimes! Don't worry, only a small part of the forest will be set aflame. So it's fine, right?
• Requires negative reputation.
• Gives herbs * (1 + main stat / 1000) * sqrt(1 + acres burnt / 1000) progress points per mana.
Every acre burnt uses up 10 magical herbs in fuel, releasing 4000 mana for you to absorb.
• For every 10% of the dark side of the forest explored, you will also gain 1 dark essence per acre burnt.
• For some reason, burning 2 acres of forest will reduce your reputation by 1.
• Unlocked at 20% Animals Fed.
burn_forest.squirrel_1:
... The squirrel seems to enjoy this a bit too much.
You've never heard a squirrel laughing so maniacally before.
And honestly? It scares you a bit. It's helpful, but...
When it's time to do another action, instead of following you, it goes somewhere else to set it on fire.
Maybe it's better to leave it alone for now...
Effect: Acts as if you have 10 more herbs on you, but lose the squirrel.
Next: trust >= 40
burn_forest.squirrel_2:
This is still disturbing to see your squirrel enjoy burning things too much...
You were expecting it to maybe be afraid, but not this!
At least, this time, when it's time to do another action, it follows you.
Phew, it seems like now it likes you better than arson, that's good!
Effect: Acts as if you have 10 more herbs on you.

bird_watching.label: Bird Watching
bird_watching.tooltip:
Far along a flower trail, there seems to be a large variety of birds flying about. Perhaps you could take up a new hobby.
• Requires glasses.
• Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset.
• Unlocked at 70% Animals Fed.
bird_watching.squirrel_1:
This was the most interesting session of bird watching you've ever seen.
Seeing a squirrel ride a bird was certainly a sight to see!
Effect: None.
bird_watching.story_1: Birds watched:⮀ You spot a colorful bird and attempt to follow it with your eyes, you fail. You try again and again until you can reliable pick out fast moving birds and animals with pinpoint precision. It's also strangely relaxing to watch birds congregate together, listening to the bird-call and watching them interact. Its fast, frenetic and savage at times, but that's nature.

dark_forest.label: Dark Forest
dark_forest.tooltip:
There's a lot of useful paths in here. You have avoided them for too long.
• Gives some additional herbs.
• Requires negative reputation.
• The witch loves this place, knowing about it will help talking to her.
Talk to Witch gives 3% more Witch Knowledge Learned per 1% Dark Forest Explored.
• Unlocked at 30% Animals Fed.
dark_forest.squirrel_1:
The squirrel assures you it won't get lost this time.
... And immediatly gets lost. Sigh...
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: squirrel combat >= 12
dark_forest.squirrel_2:
Well, apparently, last time, the squirrel didn't actually get lost.
Tree roots are apparently hunting squirrels here, and your companion was caught?!
Thankfully, it can now fight them off now!
The witch must know about all of this, let's ask her about this next time.
Effect: Talk to Witch gives a 4% bonus to this action instead of 3%.
Next: squirrel combat >= 35
dark_forest.squirrel_3:
What you've learned from the witch about this forest is quite useful!
This place is dangerous for a squirrel, but now it has no issue fighting off the roots.
Perfect! The sooner this place is explored, the sooner you can stop exploring it!
Effect: Talk to Witch gives a 5% bonus to this action instead of 3%.

talk_to_witch.label: Talk To Witch
talk_to_witch.tooltip:
Talk to the witch to learn her secrets of the dark arts.
• Requires negative reputation.
• Reduces mana cost of Practice Yin and Learn Brewing by 0.5% per 1% of Witch Knowledge.
• Her love for the dark forest also gives 3% more Dark Forest speed per 1% Witch Knowledge Learned.
• Unlocked with both 20% Dark Forest Explored and 50 Magic.
talk_to_witch.squirrel_1:
The squirrel tries to charm the witch!
... And immediatly freeze. It looks like it is scared of her.
Suddenly, you hear a loud sound on your right! But there's nothing there...
Oh? Your squirrel is gone. Weird, it was unable to move just a second ago!
Effect: Lose the squirrel.
Next: squirrel magic >= 8
talk_to_witch.squirrel_2:
You don't know why, but the squirrel looks ready this time!
When the loud sound happens, the squirrel manages to not disappear.
It looks like there's faint traces of magic around it... Did it use a spell?
The witch looks like she's about to laugh and opens up to you.
You're not sure why, but that's great!
Effect: Dark Forest gives a 4% bonus to this action instead of 3%.
Next: squirrel magic >= 8
talk_to_witch.squirrel_3:
The now familiar loud sound happens again, but this time, things are a bit different.
It looks like the witch have now light wounds on her, and your squirrel emits a lot more mana.
Well, if she was about to laugh before, now she's laughing very audibly!
You've never seen her so friendly toward you like that before. Excellent!
Effect: Dark Forest gives a 5% bonus to this action instead of 3%.
talk_to_witch.story_1: 1% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ You stumble across a small crooked hut and as you approach the boundary, a small slip of a woman step outs. She's stunning and you're immediately on guard. The area pulses with a heady hum of magic that sends shivers down your spine. She introduces herself as Evis.
talk_to_witch.story_2: 10% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ The Witch as you taken to referring to her as, seeing as she changes her name every time she introduces herself to you, is a veritable font of magical knowledge, of how to dominate the mana itself and make more from less.
talk_to_witch.story_3: 20% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ You continue to hunt down the Witch and drag more information out of her, the magic she teaches you is cruel, callous even. The witch is surprisingly personable for what you would consider a stereotypical 'Wicked Witch'.
talk_to_witch.story_4: 40% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ You start to learn more about the witches daily routine as you spend more and more time around her, the relationship you manage to cultivate with her at the start of each loop grows more familiar with each repetition. She seems to be slightly more interested each time you reveal your knowledge of dark magic.
talk_to_witch.story_5: 50% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ You had apparently impressed her enough this time that she took you to a clearing she had found, and explained to you a ritual that would give you a boost, permanently through any circumstances by calling upon the dark gods. The catch she explained, with ill concealed glee, was that you would need souls to sacrifice if you wanted to do this ritual.
talk_to_witch.story_6: 60% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ As you learn more and more about the witch and her varied names, one thing starts to become glaringly obvious. The Witch and The Hermit know one another. If her irritable grumbling about the old fool and his idiotic desires were anything to go by. You get the feeling that their relationship is complex.
talk_to_witch.story_7: 80% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ The witch is struck with a strange sense of melancholy one loop and you have no idea why, but the witch is strangely open with information and you manage to pry out more of the relationship between her and the Hermit. They were lovers once, and to your surprise, she used to be the one whom nature adores. She shuts up quickly after letting that slip. You're all the more determined to pry it out of her though.
